Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK-293T) were maintained at 37°C in a 95% air/5% CO2 humidified atmosphere incubator and grown on polyornithine-precoated 6 well plate in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM, GIBCO) containing 10% heat inactivated fetal bovine serum (GIBCO).

Readout description.Result Description: Under higher oxidative stress (0.8 mM H2O2), the Gly2385Arg variant transfected cells showed a significantly higher rate of apoptosis (8.5 ± 1.7%) compared to wild type (2.9 ± 1.3%, P = 0.01) and higher total cell death (16.6 ± 0.66% vs. 9.8 ± 2.3%, P = 0.007).

Biological replicates.Description: The mean value for three sets of experiments was taken for the analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild type LRRK2 transfected cells were used as a reference for comparison under oxidative stress conditions.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student t-test was used to compare the mean percentage of apoptosis, necrosis, and cell death between wild type and variant transfected cells.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Apoptosis rate similar to wild type under baseline or low oxidative stress (0.4 mM H2O2), approximately 0.9-1.2%.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Apoptosis rate significantly higher than wild type under high oxidative stress (0.8 mM H2O2), greater than 2.9%.

Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK-293T) were maintained at 37°C in a 95% air/5% CO2 humidified atmosphere incubator and grown on polyornithine-precoated 6 well plate in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM, GIBCO) containing 10% heat inactivated fetal bovine serum (GIBCO).

Readout description.Result Description: Confocal microscopy revealed the localization of the Gly2385Arg variant was primarily cytoplasmic with some aggregates, similar to wild type protein.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild type LRRK2 protein localization was used as a reference for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cytoplasmic localization with presence of protein aggregates similar to wild type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from cytoplasmic localization or aggregate formation compared to wild type.
